values: It's such a pretty day. The sun has been shining and it's in the 60's. Merry, my 5 yr old granddaughter, fell down the stairs at her house yesterday and has an owie now. Nothing very cool band aids couldn't help and a few princess stickers! Short post today. I'm trying to do three things at once. Have a great day everyone!

Yesterday I was complaining about too much time alone. Today, Kait and John both were home. They both had the stomach flu. I will never  complain again!!! Today, I decided to embrace the whole stay at home mom thing and spent all afternoon making dinner. I bought fresh peas still in the pod, shucked them or whatever you  do to get the peas out of the pod. Then, I simmered the fresh peas, fresh mushrooms, fresh celery and a chopped up garlic clove in olive oil. I added some red and yellow bell peppers. It was a work of art! It smelled so good! I should have stopped there, but I wanted to turn it into a tuna noodle casserole, so I added cream of celery soup. Big mistake, so I "fixed it" by adding sharp and mild cheddar cheese and two can's of tuna. I added  the noodles and put a cracker and butter topping. It looks pretty, is palatable, and I'll never make it again! Dinner from scratch 0 - frozen corn dogs 1.

I've been away for awhile. I've been in a real slump. I retired from work a year ago and that has thrown me into a tailspin. I'm going to be using this space to try to figure out what's next in my life. I'm 47 and that's too young to say it's all over. I have my family, but I need to be doing something else. Any feedback from what's left of my livejournal friends during this period will be greatly appreciated.

On to Chapter Two

It's raining in Virginia.  It's different here when it rains.  In Illinois, the storms charged through. Violent and destructive. High winds, loud thunderclaps, intense lightening. In Virginia, you're really not sure if it raining or if the air is wet. I walked a 1/2 mile to Kait's school to pick her up, waited outside for her for 15 minutes and we walked the 1/2 mile home. It was "raining". If I were driving I would have used my wipers, but all I had was a fine mist on my hair!! Virginia is certainly a gentle state.

Well, I'm all moved in.  Boxes unpacked, Computer in a useable space and summer over.  It's been a long haul, but I'm so happy we moved.  I miss all my friends in Rockford and especially my daughter and the grandbabies something fierce, though.  I've had my best friend come to visit for a week in June and DH's brother and his wife for a week in July.  Mom and Dad are coming in September and we can hardly wait.  Kaitlin had a great summer.  She learned to swim, joined the swim team, got her ears pierced, started getting an allowance for household chores and has grown in so many ways!  I got a new set of braces for my legs that I like much more than the old ones and spent most of my summer hanging out  at the pool with the other parents in the neighborhood.  This whole not working thing was much easier to get used to than I thought it would be.  I hope you all have had a wonderful Labor Day weekend!

I've been packing and moving boxes of books all day today.  I think my back is about to start rebelling.  I gave my notice at work, resigned from the Mayor's Task Force on Homelessness and all  the subcommittees,  told everyone at church and have begun to do some serious packing at work.  20 years worth of research, thank you cards, resources and just back year grant files to go through. It's going to be a long process.  I've spent the last three nights unsuccessfully trying to not cry.  This is alot harder than I thought it was going to be.  There have "secret" meetings to plan a going away party.  I'm not supposed to know, but they have them in the area outside my office!  Gotta love em! 

It's been so fun having my daughter   here with the three grandbabies.  Not such babies any more!  We've all passed around the stomach flu.  It sarted with Izack, then Lybbe, Rachel, Me, and Merry.  Notice who's not on that list! Kaitlin.  I swear that kid never gets sick!  Of course, now that I've said that she'll be puking tonight.  I hope not she's going to a sleepover.  That would not be cool!!!
OK, enough procrastinating- I see empty boxes!!!

I found this question on  's livejournal:

If you saw ME in a police car, what would you think I got arrested for?

Answer the question then you can put it on your own journal page!

OK, maybe I just got it from my daughter  who has been battling it this past week.  Sorry  ! Well we've made it through another week!  John came home last weekend and we decided moving day will be January 17th.  So this weekend will begin the packing and tossing!  Or tossing and then packing!  Wish me luck!

Last week I went to the board of elections to find out where my polling place was and was told I could vote early. Vote early I did and boy am I glad!  It sounds like a long process today.  This is a wonderful problem to have after the voter apathy of the last few national elections. 

Rachel is all settled in.  Well as settled as you can get when you can't unpack because your mother hasn't packed her stuff yet.  All the children are going to school and we are on our way to making the housing switch.  John was here last weekend.  I miss him so much.  It's great to see him, but it just reminds me how much I miss having him near.  Smell is a very powerful thing.  I smell him and just turn into a puddle.  Two years of being blindly in love as teens, 18 years of losing each other and 10 years of marriage and he still sends my heart spinning!!  OK, enough of the gooey stuff!

Remember everyone in the USA   GO VOTE!!!

We have what is  known as a very full house.  My oldest daughter  and my three grandchildren have moved in.  So the great eastward migration begins.  In a couple of months we will be moving to Virginia.  It's been really hard to be seperated from John for this long and two more months seems unbareable. But we see each other every couple of weeks.

Meanwhile, back at home, Izack was able to get a spot in the same school Kaitlin is in. Lybbe and Merry will begin pre-school next Monday.  However, Lybbe made sure to tell me that she was in kindergarden now and that pre-school is for babies.  The cut off for kindergarden in California is much later than Illinois'.  So she's going from Kindergarden back to pre-school.  She is not a happy camper. 

So things are a bit chaotic here, but it's only been a week and   has really been pulling this house together and incorporating the two households very effectively into one.  Thank you very much!!!! In a few days after things settle down I'll be posting pictures, so be prepared!

You preferred Obama's statements 67% of the time
You preferred McCain's statements 33% of the time

Voting purely on the issues you should vote Obama

Who would you vote for if you voted on the issues?

Find out now!

My mom e-mailed this and I just had to share!

Subject: Insanity


To Maintain A Healthy Level Of Insanity

1. At Lunch Time, Sit In Your Parked Car With Sunglasses on and point a
Hair Dryer At Passing Cars. See If They Slow Down.

2. Page Yourself Over The Intercom. Don't Disguise Your Voice. !

3. Every Time Someone Asks You To Do Something, ask If They Want Fries
with that.

5. Put Decaf In The Coffee Maker For 3 Weeks. Once Everyone has Gotten
Over Their Caffeine Addictions, Switch to Espresso.

6. In the Memo Field Of All Your Checks, Write 'For Marijuana'

7. Finish All Your sentences with 'In Accordance With The Prophecy'.

9. Skip down the hall Rather Than Walk and see how many looks you get.

10. Order a Diet Water whenever you go out to eat, with a serious face.

11. Specify That Your Drive-through Order Is 'To Go'.

12. Sing Along At The Opera.

14. Put Mosquito Netting Around Your Work Area and Play tropical Sounds
All Day.

15. Five Days In Advance, Tell Your Friends You Can't Attend Their Party
Because You have a headache.

17. When The Money Comes Out The ATM, Scream 'I Won! I Won!'

18. When Leaving the Zoo, Start Running towards the Parking lot, Yelling
'Run For Your Lives! They're Loose!'

19. Tell Your Children Over Dinner, 'Due To The Economy, We Are Going To
Have To Let One Of You Go.'

20 And The Final Way To Keep A Healthy Level Of Insanity .

Send This E-mail To Someone To Make Them Smile.


It's Called ....
THERAPY

Hi All- I just spent a total of six hours in the car today!  I had a meeting in the south side of Chicago-Hyde Park area- so that was 2 plus hours each way and then I drove to  Janesville, Wisconsin to meet my sister-in-law to pick up my daughter.  They took her overnight and then took her to the corn maze.  She had so much fun.  It took them over an hour to get through it and they finally had to follow another group out.  Apparently, Uncle Vince decided to go a different way and was lost for more than a half hour after that!  He finally cheated and cut throw the corn rows!  Score one for Aunt Retta and Kait!  When I picked her up she was so tired she giggled half the way home!  My oldest daughter Rachel will be moving back home on the 24th of Oct. and Kait and I are flying to Virginia on Columbus day weekend.  Oct. is turning into a very busy month!! 

Work has been so insane!  Last year we served 1,068 homeless kids.  In the first 2 months of this school year we have already served 458.  It's frightening how bad the economy is getting.  All the shelters have waiting lists and the one overnight shelter-that lets anyone in- has 18 kids there every night.  They sleep in the same room as the druggies, alcoholics and prostitutes.  Winter is coming and it's going to be a long cold one I think.  I hope we see some changes in this town quickly or many families are going to be out in the cold.

I let my friend cut my hair for me last night.  Not a good idea!  She cut it so short!  I think it's about 1/2 inch long all the way around!  I can't complain, though, I told her to cut it as short as she could and she did! OY. Well, exhaustion is setting in.  Good night all and have a great weekend!

I think I have short timers syndrome.  I always vowed I would never be one of those people that stop putting 150% into work as soon as they found out they were leaving.  I would work hard until the day I left.  Instead, I find myself not wanting to do much but the fun stuff.  I've worked with homeless kids for 20 years and I wonder what it will be like to not change lives everyday.  I feel like I'm somehow shirking my duty as a member of the human race by taking some time off and caring for my family and myself.  One of my tutors said I was changing Rachel, Kaitlin and John's lives by being available to them.  I guess I could buy that.  She also reminded me that even Jesus took time off to regroup.  I hoping Rach and the kids will be here in a couple of weeks.  I am so excited by all that is happening, but slightly terrified, too.  Well, I'm off to fight a velociraptor!!!
I could survive for 1 minute, 3 seconds chained to a bunk bed with a velociraptor

Wow, what a turn my life has made!!!  Here goes!  John got tired of being unemployable as a Literature professor so he taught himself Flash computer language and got a wonderful job in Virginia.  He's been there for about a month now and Kaitlin and I are staying here in Rockford to tie up loose ends and save money to move the household.  Since we bought this house only 3 years ago and the crash in the housing market we know we were either going to take a huge hit or try to rent it.  Well, we all know how awful out of state landlording can be.  But as always, God had another plan!  My daughter Rachel, the one on top of a mountain in California has decided to move back home.  She and the kids will be living in this house as rent to own.  It's a win - win.  We don't have to worry about the house, she has a safe reliable home to raise the kids with a fenced in back yard, fireplace in the living room, wood burning stove on the porch and three bedrooms!  I don't have to pack and move everything by myself, because she has offered to help and we don't have to find a home for every little piece of furniture.  She will take what we don't bring!!!!  It is all working out beautifully.  She's moving the first week in November.  Our goal is to move in January or February.  I'm so happy to help her and her help with this house is invaluable!

Well, after a long dry spell, I am now hooked back into the world and all my friends here on live journal.  Quick update.  John is now working in the loop in Chicago as a software engineer.  He has a job he loves that pays well enough to live off of.  We had all three grandchildren here with us for the summer.  What alot of fun, but man can a 3 yr. old, 4 yr old and 8yr old wear you out when your used to a very quiet 9 year old!!  I negotiated a new contract with the school district and got a 12% raise and work only 10 months a year.  It's rather late, for me, so I will update much more later.  So sorry I haven't been able to keep up with all the doings.  I hope to be up to speed soon.

Hi everyone! My laptop has died so I apologize for not posting. All is well here. I just wanted you to
know that I miss you all and will be back soon!

I'm still fighting this awful ick!  The stomach flu turned into pneumonia and nasty stomach pain.  I had a CT scan done yesterday on my abdomen, but I'm sure it's just stress.  Work is going well and everyone in my family is doing well.  We're all really in a very good place right now - illnesses not withstanding.  My friend has gotten her order of protection and has been able to move on.  My oldest daughter is doing well.  The mountain lions she ran into on the trail seem to have left the mountain area she lives in (yay! daughter not kibble for lions this month at least!)  My youngest daughter is just having fun being 8. John has been on a couple of job interviews and is going on one tomorrow afternoon.  We figure something has to give at some point.  My mom has just gotten hearing aides, so she can now hear her grandchildren.  I signed up at Facebook and connected with some old high school friends. And our dog Gracie is being just goofy about playing catch with herself!  



The weather is finally beginning to warm.  It actually hit 50 today.  Maybe there is a spring after all. Have a great weekend everyone!

I have been down with the stomach flu for a week now and boy is it getting old.  The puking my guts up part is over, but the icky feeling is hanging on.  I've missed two days of work and Kait stayed home today from school, because she wasn't feeling well.  J is making us Chicken Noodle soup (homemade).  It's really nice to be sick and know when you feel better you won't have to "catch up on the housework".  John went for a job interview today.  Bought a new suit, shoes the works in hopes of presenting better.  Turns out they wanted a senior programmer, not a junior programmer and he's just not there yet.  Oh, well.  

Life has been really quiet lately.  I'm not sure how to handle that!  Have a great weekend everyone.

Sorry it has taken so long for me to post again.  Things have settled down at NIU.  There's talk of tearing down Cole hall though and building a new building.  Seems a little extreme, but I don't have to pass it everyday.  I've been totally out of touch so I'll be catching up on everyone's journal over time.  John did not get the job at United Way.  They told him he was overqualified.  At least we're at a place financially that we will be OK.  I still love Jacinta.  She has become a real part of this family.  My favorite part is coming home to meals that are already planned and in process.  We are sure eating alot healthier now.  Not so much pizza and frozen foods.  

I have been walking on a treadmill 30 mins. 4 days a week for a couple of weeks and I feel so much better.  I have more energy and am in a better mood most the time.  My best friend has finalized the order of protection.  I'm so glad for her that chapter of her life is over.  Now she can move on.  Life is just really good right now.  My oldest daughter is doing well and finalizing her divorce, my youngest daughter is doing well in school, my husband is happy, my best friend is happy, my Mom is getting hearing aids, I've got a great co-worker and my house is clean with laundry done.  Life does not get any better than this!!!  Oh and my daughter, Kaitlin and I are taking sign language classes.

To all of those out there - have a great week!!!

I just want to thank everyone who commented and made me feel a little less alone in this world.  I spend so much of my life taking care of tragedies in my clients work, I forget to allow others to help me.  You are so dear to me.  

Enough with the goopy stuff!  NIU staff is in training all week and classes resume next Monday.  Everyone is just trying to move on.  There was an interesting article in todays paper.  I let you follow the link. http://www.rrstar.com/niu/x1529758771 It's about this guy that makes and plants memorial crosses all over the United States at major tragedies.  Virginia Tech students delivered a gift to NIU students in a show of support having just been through this 10 months ago.

It is sooooooo cold here.  Our driveway is a hill and it's covered with ice.  Today was the first day in the last week that I could get the car anywhere near the house.  Our dog is having a ball though.  I treated myself to a nanny/housekeeper.  She comes Mon - Fri, does the house, the laundry and starts dinner for only $140 a week!  She makes sure Kait is started on her homework and I LOVE HER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Well that's all the news!

I read the paper and I cry.  One of the girls that died was flown here and died on the way.  There is another here in Rockford in a different hospital (we have three with Level 1 trauma designations).  They are closing Cole Hall for the rest of the Academic year and will talk about leaving it closed.  I couldn't imagine walking in that hall.  They will not begin classes until February 25th.  Having had classes at Cole Hall the descriptions were too vivid for me.  I can see it all happening.  Sorry to go on about this, but it has really hit me and this whole part of Illinois hard.  Thank you for all your thoughts and prayers.

I'm so scared!  The NIU shooting that happened today is where John used to teach.  I have some of my students that have gone on to NIU and are still there.  5 dead, 18 injured-head and chest wounds, 4 in critical condition,  8 in stable. OMG, what is happening!  The local paper has stuff in it at www.rrstar.com if you're not sure what I'm talking about.  I could use some prayers for my homeless kids that are there as well as all the students that are still there.

Thank you  to
onlylisa
 for making my new icon!  It's been a whirlwind since we got home from 
summerhorse
's.  John has pneumonia and is spending most of his time on the couch trying to breath.  Grace, our dog, has been insistent on having all the attention anytime we're home.  I think she's trying to make up for the two weeks we were gone.  I don't think I'll ever get the laundry caught up and my house needs a good cleaning top to bottom!  

Good news! John got a second interview with United Way.  Since he was running a fever and struggling for air when he interviewed last Friday, we're hoping this is a good sign.  My mom and dad are getting new kitchen cabinets today.  I'm so proud of my dad.  He's letting someone else put the cabinets in.  He already put in a hardwood floor (throughout the whole house) and tore out the old cabinets.   This is really a big thing for him to step aside and let someone else do the work.  73 years old and he finally will allow someone else to help!  

OK, I have to do it! 
Cute Grandbaby story ahead  

Lybbe (middle child and 4 years old)  had asked us 5 times to come upstairs one night to cover her up with her "ni-nite".  Finally we told her we would cover her up when we came up to bed.  Minutes later, we heard Merry (youngest child-3years old) crying in the room the girls share.  John and I looked at each other and realized we had just been had by a four year old.  We went upstairs to tend to Merry while trying not to give Lybbe attention.  After Merry was asleep, we started to leave the room and a very small voice came from the other side of the room. "Grandma, could you cover me up, pleeease."  OK, I melted and went over to cover her up.  She then told me that she saw a spider on Merry's head and stepped on it for her!!!  I couldn't stand it.  I cracked up laughing.  Poor Merry though, didn't even know her sister was SAVING HER LIFE.  What are sister's for I ask you!

Have a great week everyone!

Hello Everyone,
We have returned from California and just missed the storm.  I had so much fun with the Grandbabies and Rachel.  She seems to be doing well all things considered.  This is going to be a tough divorce.  He about to be ex is continuing to make her life difficult, by not supporting her with the children at all.  When we got there, the kids were all in clothes that were too small and not nearly warm enough.  There was very little food in the house and Izack-my oldest grandchild- was telling us that Daddy got a new playstation 3 for him to use when he went over there.  John and I took the kids shopping at K-Mart and spent over $400.00 on clothes, warm pajamas, undershirts, food and other household stuff that Rachel needed.  She is working so hard to make ends meet.  The three days the kids are with Howard, she works 2 jobs.  She starts at 8 am and gets home at 11:00pm.  Because she live at the top of a mountain, she can't get food stamps or a medical card unless she can get a ride down the mountain and there are no buses that go up and down the mountain.  How does an entire population get ignored like that.  I intend on working on that issue over the next few weeks.  I called Senator Ashcroft's office and the aid I spoke with told me that was county government and the state and county government don't work together.  OK, I don't have a PHD in government, but I'm pretty sure they do!!!

Enough whining and on to the pictures!!!
Type your cut contents here.
Izack smiling at the park.  He is almost 8 years old.  This is my little guy that is mildly autistic, has severe sensory integration disorder and has CMT.  He's my sweetie guy!

This is Lybbe.  She has just turned 4 and is a force of nature!!  She has an indomitable spirit.  Nothing gets her down.

And this is my sweatheart Merry.  She just turned 3, and is an observer of the world.  She's very quiet and likes to do puzzles, color, and anything that requires her brain.  She also has CMT, but it doesn't seem as severe as Izack's
 
Grandpa and the grandbabies        Our oldest daughter Rachel and the love of her life Jesse
top to bottom:  Kaitlin-my second and last child, 8 years old with her nephew Izack and nieces Lybbe and Merry.  They weren't having ANY fun at all!!

We really had a great time there and I'm sorry I dumped in the beginning.  It's just so frustrating not being able to FIX your kids owies!!!!  I know, I know, she has to go through it herself and will be a stronger person for it, but dammit I don't want my baby to Have to.

We leave tomorrow morning to fly to see our daughter and grandbabies.  We can hardly wait.  I'll be without the internet for two weeks so I want to wish you all the most beautiful of holidays and a miraculous new year.  Be prepared, when I get back I'll have lots to share and PICTURES!!!!

Best Wishes to All My Friends!

Your Christmas Sprit Level: 80%
Your Christmas spirit is almost as big as Christmas itself. Christmas is definitely your thing. You celebrate Christmas with enthusiasm. You love every minute of the holidays. Your Christmas spirit is inspiring to everyone who runs into you during the holidays. You make everyone's day just a little bit brighter. And that's what the holidays are all about!
Do You Have the Christmas Spirit?
Thank you onlylisa for the new icons.

One week post funeral and alls well.  No family squabbles or anything.  Everything has been quite civil.  We had a Christmas party here yesterday and had a ton of fun.  There  were 6 kids and 8 adults.  We cooked hot dogs in the fireplace and then made S'mors.  We played games and just had a great time.  It's still cold here, windchills of below zero.  For those not from the midwest that is a feels like temperature.  Not much going on so I'll just post a few pics.

Something smells yummy!

John supervising the making of S'mors

Charades.

Merry Christmas Everyone!

Well, we're home.  All the arrangements have been made and the services are next Saturday.  Thank you all for your kind thoughts.  It's been a long day so I'm going to watch some Desperate  Housewives and then go to bed.

Finally, John's mother passed at 2 this morning.  This is such a relief to all of us.  She was given 3-6 weeks to live in May and has been waiting to die since then.  She has said good-bye to everyone at least a dozen times.  She has been unconcious since Thanksgiving eve.  I spent the day down there on Friday and everyone was telling her to let go and be with her husband.  She still held on.  The caregiver said she was waiting to "have cross on her head and hands".  Ginger was never a religious woman, but Barbara kept saying she was waiting for this.  I convinced the family to let me call my priest and she told me how to get hold of the Episcopal priest in Ottawa.  He went out yesterday and anointed her.  Barbara said "OK, now she die.  ~ Tonight".   (Barbara is Polish).  'nuff said.  

We're going there this afternoon, so I'll update you all later!

Happy Thanksgiving to all of you!

I am thankful for all my online friends.  I'm so glad you are all a part of my life.

We have had a wonderfully quiet day so far today.  Ordinarily, we have a bustling Thanksgiving with around 20-30 family members.  This year we stayed home.  Last year I was recouping from a hysterectomy and the folks from our church brought us turkey dinner.  It was so wonderful.  Soooo, this year we decided to help at the church and canceled on our family.  They all understood.  Anywho, the church thanksgiving dinner was canceled due to lack of a commercial refrigerator(health dept. orders) and we found ourselves deciding to have a nice quiet day at home.  Now the turkey is in the oven, we've been sledding and played some board games.  Currently we are watching the Incredibles.  No stress to have dinner at a certain time.  I love my LARGE family, but a quiet T-day is nice to!

Well, Sparkles the kitten spent the night on our sunporch all wrapped in one of Kaitlin's blankets, had a bowl of milk for breakfast and some cat food and hasn't been seen since.  Oh well,  I can't help every homeless critter.  She was kind of cute though.  I had a leadership meeting at church this afternoon and we will begin doing a celtic service in December.  It involves alot of quiet time and reflective prayer.  I will find it a challenge, since I don't do quiet time real well.  Our church will also be giving away Thanksgiving dinners, so of course, I've already given them the names of  8 families that are in need.  Sometimes I wonder if I'm being to greedy and grabbing whatever I can for my families, but no one has ever said anything.

Oh and a really wonderful thing happened today.  I sent out a district-wide email asking if any of the schools would be willing to do a coat and mitten drive for the homeless program and I received over 50 responses from the Superintendent on down to indiviual teachers wanting to help.  Some of these schools have 90% of the student body living below the poverty level, yet the kids will dig up coats to donate and hats and mittens.  I'm always amazed at the capacity of the human heart!

Our Bunnies, Snuggle Bunny and Cuddle Bunny (Kaitlin was 4 when she named them)  have recently turned 4years old.  I didn't know bunnies could live that long.  I guess they can live from 8-10 years!  Happy Birthday Bunnies!

What a great day!  I'm back on my feet and put a whole day in at work.  I got to spend an hour just rocking a newborn while his grandma looked for clothes.  That's got to be the most relaxing thing.  I, also, got 17 families signed up for thanksgiving meals, caught up on all my casenotes, met with my supervisor and found out the money is now flowing so my secretary Rose can start next week and he budgeted me more help over the Christmas crazyness!!!

Life is good!

Kaitlin and her friends found a kitten in the backyard and made him a bed on the loveseat on the sunporch.  They went to the neighbors and got cat food and gave him a bowl of milk.  I think we have a cat now.  It will have to live outside, because I'm very allergic to cats.  It has a flee collar on so we are going to try to find it's home tomorrow.  Meanwhile it will be safe for the night.  I know nothing about cats!!!! I am definitely a dog person.

My granddaughter turned 4 on Sunday.  I can't wait to get out to California to see them.  We fly out on Christmas eve.  We're going to tell the kids Santa stopped at our house in Illinois and brought us to them.  I'm not sure how we'll explain the rented car.  Can Santa carry a car in his sleigh???

We haven't heard about the job at the Register Star yet.  So please keep us in your prayers and thoughts.  Well, we're off to see the kitten.  Have a great evening everyone-or whatever time of the day your at!

Yay!  I'm finally beginning to feel like this cold may be lifting.  I've had bursts of energy of and on today, so I've even gotten some housework done.  I have a great husband who has kept the dishes and laundry going, but he just doesn't seem to like to dust or vacuum much.  Kaitlin is having Nadia over for the night.  She is one of the girls we took in last spring when her parents went into drug rehab.  We just really love having the girls over.  It was such a very important part of all of our lives.

John and Kaitlin have been reading the Chronicles of Narnia.  She is really enjoying them.  He reads a chapter to her and then she reads a chapter to him.  I love listening to them!

It's late and I'm going to go to bed.  It wouldn't be good to get too tired right now.  I want to keep on the road to recovery here!

Man, I'm still fighting this bug.  I'm told it lasts up to 9 days.  I don't have time for that.  I stayed home and chugged orange juice all day today.  I've been working on this cross stitch my mother-in-law started for my youngest granddaughter.  She has made one for each of the little guys, but lost the sight in one eye before she had a chance to finish this one.  The work is so tiny and fine, I can't believe she was able to do this as long as she had.  She's 83 years old and just this last year has gone downhill fast!!  We keep being told any day now, but it's been 5 months of hearing that.  We're getting a little skeptical.  I feel so bad for her.  She just lays around all day  waiting to die.  What a miserable existance.  If she were an animal we'd be free to treat her better.

Enough of the negative stuff.  It's almost turkey day and I can smell the snow in the air.  We sit by the fire every evening and Kaitlin does her homework.  I LOVE this time of year.  Sweaters, turtle necks, leaves, crisp air, and autumn sunshine.  It just doesn't get any better!!!!

Have a wonderful Thursday everyone!

I came home from work early today because I've been fighting a cold and finally lost!  My hunny just ran to Walgreens for some Zycam and brought me a bag of M&M's.  Now the Zycam may work, but we all know it's the M&M's that will HEAL me!  Off to OD on chocolate!!!

<lj-poll-1082952> As you can see from the poll, I've had a frustrated journal experience tonight.  Short version - my oldest daughter is getting a divorce, very proud of her for her strength of character.  John did not get the job in Chicago, but has a third interview with the Rockford Register Star tomorrow at 1pm.  Kaitlin is all snuggled in her jammies and watching Simpson's Treehouse of Horror.  My dog is obsessing over the frisbee ( Border Collie).  And I've just enjoyed a day of shopping with my oldest sister(I have four of them) Wendy.<br /="/"><br /="/">Say some prayers, cross your fingers or whatever you do tomorrow at 1pm.  Thanks.

After a very long dry spell, I have my own laptop again.  You may or may not remember that my old laptop went poof right in the middle of a Sudoku game.  After 5 years of faithful service, it finally could do no more Sudoku.  (a moment of silence, please).  OK, that's enough.  We had another laptop in the bottom of the closet, because my husband forgot the password to get windows to start up.  LOL  So we bought a new copy of Windows and here I am!!!!

There is so much to catch up on. 

Kaitlin's play is next week, so most of our time is spent driving her to and from play practice.  She's really doing well.  She's had practice until 8 pm every night this week and has still been able to keep her homework up and hasn't gotten whiney from lack of sleep. 

John is still teaching at a local business college.  He has an interview on Tuesday for a cope editor job with the Rockford Register Star.  It would mean enough money to pay our bills, but the hours will be from 5 pm - 1 am  which would include one weekend day a week.  It will be a job he will enjoy, though.  He started out as a journalist, became a Metro Editor (hated it), went back to journalism, then went back to school to get his Masters.  He says this job is everything he has liked about journalism minus the things he hated.  He's very much an introvert and having to interview someone who has just experienced a tragedy, so he can write a story that "will sell papers"  is just NOT his thing.  

After a very, very long month, I have a new assistant.  He' wonderful.  We've known each other for 11 years and have worked together on common cases before.  He has a great sense of humor, which you all know is critical for me.  If you can't laugh and be silly, what's the sense in living!!!  We have had over 400 kids become homeless since July 1st.  You have to be able to laugh and be silly or you would die from the tragedy of it all.  Oh, Oh speaking of that, on Oct 8th on the CW channel at 3 there will be a documentary called "Amazing Invisible Children".  They filmed some of it here in Rockford with my program!!!!  I'm not sure how much of it will be on the show, but 2 clips are in the trailer.  If you get a chance to watch it let me know what you think!

I have missed you all sooooo much, I feel like I've come home after being away for a very long time!!  I didn't realize how important you are in my life.  Thank you to all of you for being out there!!!!!

Yay!  I got our old laptop up and running and I'm back on board again!!!!  So much has been going on, but I'm beat.  I promise an updated tomorrow!  Until then, breathe easy and sleep well, my friends.

Just a quick "Hello, I'm still alive"  I've been very negligent in my posts and responses, but I have been keeping up with  you  all.  I'm very sorry.  I get my laptop back soon, then I'll be back on board.  I've been using my dh's puter which is set up for a lefty.  I get a neck ache if I type or look at the screen too long.  Hopefully, I'll be back on board next week.

Miss you all!!
